page.title: 09Population and Employment
page.content: We estimate the population of our block to be just over 1000.Although the population is now growing,the area has less people living in it now than it used to.We know this because older people recall many shops that have closed and houses that have been demolished.In 1903 there were 179 children in Stetchworth school.There are now 49 and the school at Woodditton closed two years ago.Stetchworth used to have three public houses.Now it has one.The chairman of the parish council,a farmer,believes the fall in population is due to modern farming methods.Use of chemicals has enabled farmers to change from stock to arable.This and mechanisation means there are fewer jobs.Most people now commute to Newmarket or Cambridge.The most common occupation is in Building not Farming.
